posts.title: Savitribai Phule Pune University
posts.content:
Third Year of Computer Engineering (2019 Course) 310255: Internship
Duration:
Internship is to be completed after semester 5 and before commencement of semester 6 of at least 4 to 6 weeks; and it is to be assessed and evaluated in semester 6.
Internship work Identification:
Student may choose to undergo Internship at
Industry/
Govt. Organizations/
NGO/
MSME/
Rural Internship/ Innovation/IPR/Entrepreneurship.
Industry/NGO‚Äôs/Government organizations/Micro/Small/ Medium enterprises to make themselves ready for the industry [1].
Students must register at Internshala [2].
Contribution in Incubation/ Innovation/ Entrepreneurship Cell/ Institutional Innovation Council/ startups cells of institute /
Learning at Departmental Lab/Tinkering Lab/ Institutional workshop, Development of new product/ Business Plan/ registration of start-up, Industry / Government Organization Internship,
Internship through Internshala,
In-house product development, intercollegiate, inter department research internship under research lab/group, micro/small/medium enterprise/online internship,
Research internship under professors, IISC, IIT's, Research organizations, NGOs or Social Internships, rural internship,
Participate in open-source development.
Internship Diary/ Internship Workbook:
Students must maintain Internship Diary/ Internship Workbook.
The students should record in the daily training diary the day-to-day account of the observations, impressions, information gathered and suggestions given, if any.
The training diary/workbook should be signed every day by the supervisor. Internship Diary/workbook and Internship Report should be submitted by the students along with attendance record and an evaluation sheet duly signed and stamped by the industry to the Institute immediately after the completion of the training.
Internship Work Evaluation:
Every student is required to prepare a maintain documentary proofs of the activities done by him as internship diary or as workbook.
The evaluation of these activities will be done by Programme Head/Cell In-charge/ Project Head/ faculty mentor or Industry Supervisor based on- Overall compilation of internship activities, sub-activities, the level of achievement expected, evidence needed to assign the points and the duration for certain activities.
Assessment and Evaluation is to be done in consultation with internship supervisor (Internal and External ‚Äì a supervisor from place of internship.
Recommended evaluation parameters-Post Internship Internal Evaluation -50 Marks + Internship Diary/Workbook and Internship Report - 50 Marks
Evaluation through Seminar Presentation/Viva-Voce at the Institute-
The student will give a seminar based on his training report, before an expert committee constituted by the concerned department as per norms of the institute. The evaluation will be based on the following criteria:
Depth of knowledge and skills: Communication and Presentation Skills Team Work
Creativity
Planning and Organizational kills Adaptability
Analytical Skills
Attitude and Behavior at work Societal Understanding
Ethics
Regularity and punctuality Attendance record Diary/Work book
Student‚Äôs Feedback from External Internship Supervisor
After completion of Internship, the student should prepare a comprehensive report to indicate what he has observed and learnt in the training period.
Internship Diary/workbook may be evaluated on the basis of the following criteria: Proper and timely documented entries
Adequacy & quality of information recorded Data recorded
Thought process and recording techniques used Organization of the information
The report shall be presented covering following recommended fields but limited to,
Title/Cover Page
Internship completion certificate
Internship Place Details- Company background-organization and activities/Scope and object of the study / Supervisor details
Index/Table of Contents Introduction
Title/Problem statement/objectives Motivation/Scope and rationale of the study Methodological details
Results / Analysis /inferences and conclusion
Suggestions / Recommendations for improvement to industry, if any Attendance Record
Acknowledgement
List of reference (Library books, magazines and other sources)
Feedback from internship supervisor (External and Internal)
Post internship, faculty coordinator should collect feedback about student with following recommended parameters-
Technical knowledge, Discipline, Punctuality, Commitment, Willingness to do the work, Communication skill, individual work, Team work, Leadership
Reference:
https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/AICTE%20Internship%20Policy.pdf
https://internship.aicte-india.org/

posts.author: writer1
posts.title: Application for Workshop
posts.content:
To,
Date : 29-08-2025
Academics Dean/ Principal
Dr. D. Y. Patil Technical Campus,
Varale-Talegaon, Pune .
Subject: Permission to Organize Workshop and Zonal Competition in Collaboration with IIT Bombay
Respected Sir/Madam,
I request your kind permission to organize a technical workshop in collaboration with IIT Bombay, followed by a zonal-level competition at our campus. The event will be limited to 200 participants, as the final stage involves a Robotics Bot Competition with provided materials. After the workshop, the zonal competition will be conducted by our college faculty under IIT Bombay‚Äôs initiative.
A team of three IITians will visit our campus to guide the sessions, and the winning team of four students will receive certificates and a direct entry to IIT Bombay‚Äôs Tech Fest, which otherwise requires multiple selection rounds. This event will provide great exposure and bring recognition to our institute.
I sincerely request your approval to conduct this workshop and competition under the banner of Dr. D. Y. Patil Technical Campus, Pune.
Thanking you,
President
Developer Student Club
DYPTC
Pawar Abhinav Sujit
President, DSC
Prof. Nishiket Bansode
Faculty Coordinator, DSC

posts.author: writer1
posts.title: üè• Rural Healthcare IVR + AI Triage System (Your SIH Project)
posts.content:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Problem You‚Äôre Solving
Rural patients don‚Äôt have smartphones/internet ‚Üí can‚Äôt use telemedicine apps.
Doctors are few, and small cases overload big hospitals.
No real-time triage: Everyone goes to hospital ‚Üí time & money wasted.
Medicine availability unknown ‚Üí patients travel, then find ‚Äúnot available‚Äù.
Emergency delay ‚Üí ambulances not auto-alerted.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Your Solution (MVP)
A phone call based AI assistant (IVR system) that:
Talks to patient in local language via normal call.
Asks yes/no or simple questions about symptoms.
AI model decides:
Mild ‚Üí give medicine info.
Moderate ‚Üí doctor review.
Severe ‚Üí alert doctor + 108 ambulance.
Sends doctor dashboard + SMS alerts.
Shows medicine availability (mock/real database).
3Ô∏è‚É£ Architecture (Step by Step)
üîπ Input Layer (Voice Capture)
Patient calls a toll-free number (IVR).
System records patient‚Äôs voice.
üõ† Tools:
Twilio / Exotel / Airtel IVR API ‚Üí to get calls from rural users.
Whisper (STT model) ‚Üí convert speech to text.
üîπ AI Triage Layer (Decision Making)
Patient‚Äôs text symptoms ‚Üí sent to AI model.
AI decides severity using rules + ML model.
üõ† Tools:
LLM: openbmb/MiniCPM4.1-8B or baidu/ERNIE-4.5-21B.
Prompting: Simple prompt like
‚ÄúIf patient has fever + chest pain ‚Üí severe, else if mild fever ‚Üí mild.‚Äù
üîπ Knowledge / Medicine Availability
AI checks if medicine is available.
üõ† Tools:
google/embeddinggemma-300m ‚Üí store medicine + pharmacy info.
Small mock database of Jan Aushadhi medicines.
üîπ Output Layer (Response Back)
AI generates response ‚Üí converted into speech.
System plays back voice response to patient.
üõ† Tools:
Text-to-Speech (TTS):
ResembleAI/chatterbox (good for IVR)
or microsoft/VibeVoice-1.5B
üîπ Doctor Dashboard
Simple web app showing:
Patient symptoms
AI severity label (green/yellow/red)
Medicine suggested
Emergency flag (red case ‚Üí SMS doctor + 108 ambulance).
üõ† Tools:
Frontend: React.js / simple HTML dashboard.
Backend: Flask / FastAPI (Python).
Database: SQLite or Firebase (for hackathon demo).
4Ô∏è‚É£ End-to-End Flow (Example)
Patient dials IVR number.
‚ÄúNamaste, aapko kya problem hai? Bukhaar hai?‚Äù
Patient: ‚ÄúHaan, 2 din se bukhaar hai, saath me saans lene me dikkat.‚Äù
STT ‚Üí converts to text.
AI triage ‚Üí ‚ÄúFever + breathing issue = Severe case‚Äù.
Dashboard ‚Üí Doctor sees RED alert + patient details.
SMS ‚Üí Patient: ‚ÄúPlease go to nearest hospital, ambulance is on the way.‚Äù
TTS ‚Üí speaks to patient in Hindi/Marathi with instructions.
If medicine needed ‚Üí AI checks Jan Aushadhi DB ‚Üí sends nearest availability info.
5Ô∏è‚É£ Tech Stack (Final Recommendation)
Layer
Tool/Model
Call Handling
Twilio / Exotel IVR
Speech-to-Text (STT)
Whisper (OpenAI)
Translation (if needed)
tencent/Hunyuan-MT-7B
AI Triage (LLM)
openbmb/MiniCPM4.1-8B
Embeddings DB
google/embeddinggemma-300m
Text-to-Speech (TTS)
ResembleAI/Chatterbox OR VibeVoice
Backend
Flask/FastAPI
Dashboard
React.js / Simple HTML
Alerts (SMS/108)
Twilio SMS API / Manual trigger
6Ô∏è‚É£ Demo Plan for Hackathon
Step 1: Patient (judge) calls IVR demo number.
Step 2: System asks 2‚Äì3 symptom questions (Hindi/English).
Step 3: Judge answers.
Step 4: AI classifies case (mild/moderate/severe).
Step 5: Dashboard updates live with judge‚Äôs details.
Step 6: System plays back doctor‚Äôs advice in voice.
Step 7: Optional ‚Üí Show medicine DB search or ambulance SMS.
7Ô∏è‚É£ Why This is a Strong SIH Idea
Social Impact: Directly solves rural healthcare access.
Tech Innovation: Uses AI + IVR + voice models (unique combo).
Scalability: Works on basic phones, not just smartphones.
Hackathon Friendly: You can demo with mock DB + Twilio trial.
